# Abstract

Here, I re-re-examine the analysis of Oeppen and Vaupel (2002).

# Life Expectancy Analysis

We will try two full solutions


```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(gapminder)
data(gapminder_unfiltered)
head(gapminder_unfiltered)
gapminder_unfiltered%>% 
  group_by(year)%>%
  summarize(maxlife = max(lifeExp, na.rm = TRUE)) -> cdf
head(cdf)
  
semi_join(gapminder_unfiltered, cdf, by = c("lifeExp"= "maxlife", "year"))%>%
  arrange(year)


gapminder_unfiltered%>%
  group_by(year)%>%
  filter(lifeExp == max(lifeExp))%>%
  select(country, lifeExp, year)%>%
  arrange(year) -> sumdat

head(sumdat)
  


```

We will now recreate the plot from Oeppen and Vaupel(2002).

```{r}
sumdat %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=year, y=lifeExp)) + 
  geom_point(aes(fill=country), color="black", pch=21, size=3) + 
  geom_smooth(method="lm", color="blue", se=FALSE) +
  ylab("Life Expectancy") +
  xlab("Year")
```
